description:
As a Technical Writer in Global Security and Resilience Services (GSRS), you’ll be part of a global team working to ensure that Google is prepared and ready to manage physical security, enterprise security resilience, and large scale operational incidents effectively, with the least amount of impact on our business, users, or brand. You’ll act as a document control specialist for cross-product teams throughout the product lifecycle, writing, editing, and rewriting technical content as well as enforcing document standards, reviewing for completeness, and organizing reviews. You will also partner with various levels of the organization to ensure a document is technically accurate, typo-free, grammar and punctuation appropriate and proper, and the writing reflects Google’s brand.

In this role, you will work as a resource specialist in writing, cataloging, and maintaining business and technical publications. You will creates, writes, and edit publications, including reports, manuals, briefs, proposals, procedures, and related materials. Additionally, you will conduct interviews with subject-matter experts to understand and present technical materials and parameters of technical content and the presentation of such content.

From keeping Googlers safe and secure to managing disruptive events, the ability to anticipate, deter, detect, and act are the pillars of Google’s Global Security and Resilience Services (GSRS) team. As a member of GSRS you will help develop a culture where safety, security and resiliency are integrated into every facet of Google, including the creative process. You will help us continually identify, evaluate and monitor enterprise risks that could affect business activities and provide business leaders the information they need to make critical decisions. You'll collaborate with cross-functional teams to create innovative strategies and develop programs that drive sustainable effectiveness.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in English, Communications, Journalism, a technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience in document processing, spreadsheets, database management, and graphics production software.
  • Ability to work under time constraints, high operational tempo, and deadlines.
  • 5 years of writing/editing experience in a professional writing position.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Editorial certification.
  • Experience writing or editing physical security, enterprise resilience, employee welfare, analytical, and/or health and safety documents, presentations, and tools.
  • Experience with G Suite.
  • Excellent collaboration and facilitation skills.
responsibilities:
• Be involved in writing projects from the planning stage through to completion or join at the draft or final product review stage to review, edit, and rewrite copies as necessary - performing various levels of edits are necessary.
  • Set and ensure document standards are enforced, such as organization, logical order and structure, presentation, word use, illustration, comprehensibility, completeness and correctness, retrievability, tone, coherence, and gender-neutral style.
  • Assist writers in developing material, planning or assisting with the planning of the documents, spreadsheets, presentations, and intranet, necessary for a project, including but not limited to content and other resource requirements or references.
  • Uses rule-based editing to make a document correct, consistent, accurate, and complete through spelling, grammar, punctuation, capitalization, hyphenation, adherence to legal requirements (copyright, trademarks, etc.), internal consistency (design, typography, layout and illustrations), and bibliographic references and citation as appropriate.
  • Uses analysis-based editing to evaluate the document or product for concept, content, organization, form, and style and make it functional for readers.
title: Technical Writer, Global Security and Resilience Services
